headline: Poll: No clear frontrunner among Republican US Senate candidates
sentences:
The results are as follows:
Dr. Mehmet Oz: 16%
Dave McCormick: 15%
Kathy Barnette: 7%
Jeff Bartos: 6%
Carla Sands: 5%
George Bochetto: 2%
Someone else: 6%
Do not know: 43%
On the Democratic side, here are the results:
John Fetterman: 41%
Conor Lamb: 17%
Malcolm Kenyatta: 4%
Someone else: 9%
None: 2%
Do not know: 26%
Other findings
Economic concerns remain high, with voters continuing to feel frustrated and mostly dissatisfied with President Joe Biden's performance.
The data represents the responses of 785 registered Pennsylvania voters, including 356 Democrats, 317 Republicans and 112 independents.
The latest Franklin & Marshall College poll found there is no clear frontrunner in the race for the Republican nomination.

Methodology
The survey findings are based on interviews conducted from March 30 through April 10.
More than one in three respondents said they are worse off financially than a year ago.
Only one in four registered voters believes the state is headed in the right direction.
Voters were asked who they would choose if the primary were being held today.
We have Commitment 2022 election coverage of the race for U.S. Senate.
One-on-one with Democratic US Senate candidate Conor Lamb
